str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Of Hebrew origin; Samaria, a city and region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
